intro: Haemodorum distichophyllum, commonly known as the red and yellow flag, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its vivid red and yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting a variety of pollinators. The plant has opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and creeklines. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
